mend.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing
mend.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: My father used to mend our shoes.
mend.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to repair something that is broken or not working
mend.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: When are you going to mend that light in the hall?
Tim can mend any broken toy.
mend.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if a broken bone mends, it becomes whole again
mend.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: His leg isn’t mending as quickly as he’d expected.
mend.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to end a quarrel or difficult situation by dealing with the problem that is causing it
mend.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I’ve tried to mend matters between us, but she’s still very angry.
mend.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a place in something where it has been repaired
mend.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The economy is now on the mend.
